description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2v645","text":"Standard of procedure for cryomiller Retsch at the Soft Materials Laboratory (EPFL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"22aho","text":"Use two wrenches to unscrew the N2 pipe from the dewar. Firmly push downwards both wrenches at the same time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lovxv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7drgp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BD4ED546345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":412,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"2vt78\",\"text\":\"Unscrew the N2 line from the dewar.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Asset 1.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2mb3twp.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2jb3twp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2kb3twp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2ib3twp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7gn8h","text":"Place the dewar in the lift and block the wheels. Pull the red strap in front of the door of the lift and send the lift to floor 0. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50fa6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"tqwpd","text":"Hand-tight the butterfly screw of the N2 line to the inlet valve of the dewar.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":null,"entityRanges":null,"data":{}},{"key":"skldw","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"manj1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":null,"entityRanges":null,"data":{}},{"key":"1lmg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BD512E52345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":204,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Asset 9.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2rb3twp.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2pb3twp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2qb3twp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2nb3twp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"58qs1","text":"Open the inlet and the outlet valve of the dewar.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lf2uk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9nftl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BD525E0F345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":412,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"IMG_20230516_101938.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2vb3twp.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2tb3twp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2ub3twp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2sb3twp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d45ca","text":"Screw the N2 line to the dewar. Hand-tight the N2 line by using two wrenches. Do not over-tight the bolts.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53uso","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1i483","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BD53CF96345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":412,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"bi6d0\",\"text\":\"Screw the N2 line to the dewar.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Asset 2.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2zb3twp.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2xb3twp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2yb3twp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt2wb3twp.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"s2hj","text":"Open the inlet valve of the dewar.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"lnyvn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cg1vo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BE1D1B85345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":412,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"339l8\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Asset 4.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt25b3twp.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt23b3twp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt24b3twp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt22b3twp.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"css6b","text":"Switch on the cryomiller.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4bm8c","text":"Have you already used the cryomiller?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Quick and dirty - First time user
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1roe6","text":"I have never milled my samples before and I have no idea of which parameters to use. Firstly, I want to get an idea of how the milling process works on my samples and then I will optimize my protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Experienced user
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8hds5","text":"I have milled my samples before and I know which protocol to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ucq","text":"If you already have an established milling protocol, you can save the parameters in a free memory bank (for example P3, in the picture).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":116,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"wy1tp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"chc53","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BE2A70FF345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":212,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Asset 7.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt29b3twp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt27b3twp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt28b3twp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt26b3twp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fq7v6","text":"The milling jar volume is 50 mL. The sample to be milled should occupy maximum about 1/3 of the total jar volume. For efficient milling, introduce 10 mL to 20 mL of sample in the milling jar.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":78,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fhvdl","text":"If your material can be prepared in smaller pieces, cut it or break it to facilitate the milling process.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bsr5","text":"Example: Materials like paper, plastic films, and hydrogels can be cut into small pieces by scissors.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"762ld","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6uiuc","text":"Tip: use a milling ball whose diameter is about 3x the size of the biggest particle composing your sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":48,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8a26","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"nkgpg","text":"Set the main switch (red) to 1. Then, press the green button. The green button lights up and the line of the N2 reservoir is now open.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":null,"entityRanges":null,"data":{}},{"key":"ijlqw","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bk1vb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E93EEB43345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":203,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Asset 10.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3db3twp.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3bb3twp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3cb3twp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3ab3twp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnnm1","text":"Turn the tap counterclockwise to start filling up the dewar. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aifls","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a2knh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E9421D66345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":411,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Asset 13.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3hb3twp.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3fb3twp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3gb3twp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3eb3twp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"31q88","text":"Monitor the dewar as it get refilled. The dewar is full when you see some liquid nitrogen coming out of the outlet valve of the dewar (see video).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fb3dh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e5fr5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"video","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E943B0A6345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":0,"is_video":true,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"video/mp4","original_name":"Tank_filled.mp4","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mqrkb3twp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mqrjb3twp.mp4","type":3,"width":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26n4e","text":"Put on your cryogenic gloves. Close the tap. Then, close the inlet and the outlet valve of the dewar.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"idnd","text":"Unscrew the butterfly screw from the dewar. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"yc3tb","text":"Build up pressure inside the dewar by slowly opening the pressure build-up valve. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dk8t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tmat","text":"Let the pressure rise to 1 bar, then close the pressure build-up valve. Wait for the pressure to drop below 0.5 bar (~ 10 seconds). Then, slowly open again the pressure build-up valve until you reach 1 bar. Repeat this process for 3 times until the pressure stabilizes around 1 bar.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s9ij","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r82d","text":"Note: reaching a stable pressure value may require some hours, due to the pressure feedback system of the dewar. Monitor the internal pressure of the dewar during your first cryomilling cycle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gdr6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dgt7","text":"Tip: refill the dewar at least 2 h before using the cryomiller, to allow pressure to stabilize. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kpudf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dqj24","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E947CF28345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":412,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Asset 17.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3mb3twp.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3jb3twp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3kb3twp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3ib3twp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fo0eq","text":"Tip: 1/3 of the volume filled with the sample, 1/3 of milling balls, 1/3 of free space. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ch63","text":"To run a quick and dirty test, use the \"--\" program: this is a blank memory slot that allows you to try a quick test without saving the milling parameters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhgl6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9q70e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E96C98C1345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":261,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Asset 6.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3rb3twp.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3pb3twp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3qb3twp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mt3nb3twp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9i2o6","text":"When the dewar is full, set the main switch (red) to 0. This step closes the electronic valve between the main reservoir and the filling line.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1rbb0","text":"Tip: Refill the dewar at least 2 h before using the cryomiller. Ideally, plan to refill the dewar the day before using the cryomiller.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88r4u","text":"Refilling in advance allows the pressure inside the dewar to stabilize, avoiding issue during the cryomilling cycles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Cryomiller SOP
